verses.kjv: Behold, I will send my messenger, and he shall prepare the way before me: and the LORD, whom ye seek, shall suddenly come to his temple, even the messenger of the covenant, whom ye delight in: behold, he shall come, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am sending my messenger, and he will clear the path ahead of me. Then the LORD you are searching for will suddenly arrive at his temple. The messenger of the covenant that you take pleasure in — look, he is coming," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: But who may abide the day of his coming? and who shall stand when he appeareth? for he is like a refiner’s fire, and like fullers’ soap:
verses.ct: But who will be able to endure the day he arrives? Who can remain standing when he appears? He is like the fire of a metalworker and like the strongest laundry soap.

verses.kjv: And he shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver: and he shall purify the sons of Levi, and purge them as gold and silver, that they may offer unto the LORD an offering in righteousness.
verses.ct: He will sit like someone refining and purifying silver. He will purify the sons of Levi and refine them like gold and silver, so that they will bring offerings to the LORD in righteousness.

verses.kjv: Then shall the offering of Judah and Jerusalem be pleasant unto the LORD, as in the days of old, and as in former years.
verses.ct: At that time, the offerings from Judah and Jerusalem will be pleasing to the LORD, just as they were in ancient times and in years long past.

verses.kjv: And I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against false swearers, and against those that oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow, and the fatherless, and that turn aside the stranger from his right, and fear not me, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: "Then I will approach you for judgment. I will be quick to testify against those who practice sorcery, against those who commit adultery, against those who swear falsely, against those who cheat workers out of their wages, against those who exploit widows and orphans, against those who deny justice to foreigners, and against those who have no reverence for me," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: For I am the LORD, I change not; therefore ye sons of Jacob are not consumed.
verses.ct: "Because I am the LORD and I do not change — that is why you descendants of Jacob have not been destroyed.

verses.kjv: Even from the days of your fathers ye are gone away from mine ordinances, and have not kept them. Return unto me, and I will return unto you, saith the LORD of hosts. But ye said, Wherein shall we return?
verses.ct: Ever since the time of your ancestors, you have turned away from my instructions and have not followed them. Come back to me, and I will come back to you," says the LORD of hosts. "But you ask, 'How are we supposed to come back?'

verses.kjv: Will a man rob God? Yet ye have robbed me. But ye say, Wherein have we robbed thee? In tithes and offerings.
verses.ct: Would anyone dare to rob God? Yet you are robbing me. But you ask, 'How have we robbed you?' Through your tithes and offerings.

verses.kjv: Ye are cursed with a curse: for ye have robbed me, even this whole nation.
verses.ct: You are living under a curse because you have been robbing me — this entire nation has.

verses.kjv: Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse, that there may be meat in mine house, and prove me now herewith, saith the LORD of hosts, if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing, that there shall not be room enough to receive it.
verses.ct: Bring the full tithe into the storehouse so that there will be food in my house. Test me in this," says the LORD of hosts, "and see if I won't throw open the windows of heaven and pour out such a blessing on you that you won't have enough room to contain it.

verses.kjv: And I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes, and he shall not destroy the fruits of your ground; neither shall your vine cast her fruit before the time in the field, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: I will keep the pests from destroying your crops, and the vines in your fields will not drop their fruit too early," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: And all nations shall call you blessed: for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: "Then every nation will call you blessed, because your land will be a place of delight," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: Your words have been stout against me, saith the LORD. Yet ye say, What have we spoken so much against thee?
verses.ct: "You have spoken harsh words against me," says the LORD. "Yet you ask, 'What have we said against you?'

verses.kjv: Ye have said, It is vain to serve God: and what profit is it that we have kept his ordinance, and that we have walked mournfully before the LORD of hosts?
verses.ct: You have said, 'Serving God is pointless. What have we gained by keeping his requirements and walking around in mourning before the LORD of hosts?

verses.kjv: And now we call the proud happy; yea, they that work wickedness are set up; yea, they that tempt God are even delivered.
verses.ct: From now on, we consider the arrogant to be the fortunate ones. Those who do evil seem to prosper, and those who test God apparently get away with it.'"

verses.kjv: Then they that feared the LORD spake often one to another: and the LORD hearkened, and heard it, and a book of remembrance was written before him for them that feared the LORD, and that thought upon his name.
verses.ct: Then those who deeply revered the LORD talked with each other, and the LORD listened and heard them. A scroll of remembrance was written in his presence about those who deeply revered the LORD and honored his name.

verses.kjv: And they shall be mine, saith the LORD of hosts, in that day when I make up my jewels; and I will spare them, as a man spareth his own son that serveth him.
verses.ct: "They will belong to me," says the LORD of hosts, "on the day when I gather my treasured people. I will have compassion on them, just as a father has compassion on his own son who serves him.

verses.kjv: Then shall ye return, and discern between the righteous and the wicked, between him that serveth God and him that serveth him not.
verses.ct: Then once again you will see the difference between those who are righteous and those who are wicked, between those who serve God and those who do not."
